data.title: Music History Lesson: Roy Clark, Guitar Virtuoso and Instrumentalist
data.meta_description: Explore the life and musical legacy of Roy Clark, the iconic guitarist and beloved entertainer.
data.text:
Who is Roy Clark?

Any time I am asked about great or influential guitar players, and it does happen out in the wild from time to time. There is one that is usually somewhere at the top of the list that people may not be aware of. Roy Clark.

Roy Clark is an important figure when it comes to American country music, he secured his name in history as a virtuoso guitarist with his unique and entertaining stage presence as well as his impressive technical ability.

Not just with the guitar, but with several instruments. Each played with the same level of talent and showmanship that made audiences love him.

He is someone I often reference so I figured I’d make more people aware of him here as well.

Early life.

Roy Linwood Clark was born on April 15, 1933, into a musical family rooted in country and bluegrass music. From a young age, he displayed a natural aptitude for the guitar, mastering the instrument with skill and precision.

Clark’s father was a semi-professional musician who played banjo, fiddle, and guitar and his mother played piano. So music was always part of his…
